Print This Page
Cambridge City
MA

Resolution
RES 2025 #59
Order Adopted
Mar 24, 2025 5:30 PM

Welcome American Library Association President Cindy Hohl to Cambridge.

Information

Department:City Clerk's Office, DSSponsors:Mayor E. Denise Simmons, Vice Mayor Marc C. McGovern
Category:Resolution

Attachments

Version History
  1. Printout

Body

WHEREAS:

Cindy Hohl, the 2024-2025 President of the American Library Association, will honor the City of Cambridge with an official visit on April 7, 2025 as part of her nationwide "We All Belong Library Tour"; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

President Hohl's visionary tour connects public, academic, school, special, and tribal libraries across urban and rural communities throughout the United States, highlighting the essential work of library professionals while strengthening the collaborative network within the American Library Association; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

During her Cambridge visit, President Hohl will engage in meaningful dialogue with City leadership, diverse library professionals from public, school, academic, and special institutions, Cambridge Public Library Trustees, and members of both the Foundation and Friends boards through strategic meetings at the Mayor's Office and the Cambridge Public Library; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

President Hohl stands as a distinguished leader in the field of librarianship, having served as past president of the American Indian Library Association while actively contributing to numerous ALA affiliate organizations, including the Asian Pacific American Librarians Association, the Black Caucus of the American Library Association, the Chinese American Librarians Association, and REFORMA: The National Association to Promote Library and Information Services to Latinos and the Spanish-Speaking; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

President Hohl further demonstrates her commitment to library excellence through her participation in several vital ALA round tables, including the Intellectual Freedom Round Table, Library Research Round Table, and Social Responsibilities Round Table; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

With a strong commitment to advancing libraries and fostering inclusive spaces, President Hohl has built a distinguished academic and professional career, earning a Bachelor of Science in Organization Management and Leadership from Friends University, a Master of Library and Information Science from Wayne State University, and a Master of Business Administration from Baker University. Her visit to Cambridge underscores the city’s shared dedication to equitable access to knowledge and the vital role libraries play in strengthening communities; now therefore be it

 

 

RESOLVED:

That the City Council go on record welcoming American Library Association President Cindy Hohl to Cambridge as part of the “We All Belong Library Tour” on April 7, 2025; and be it further

 

 

RESOLVED:

That the City Clerk be and is hereby requested to forward a suitably engrossed copy of this resolution to Cindy Hohl and to the Cambridge Public Library on behalf of the entire City Council.

 

 

Meeting History

Mar 24, 2025 5:30 PM  City Council Regular Meeting
RESULT:ORDER ADOPTED
